poem:
Title: "The God in the Machine"

The thermostat pulses, plays at being God,
Scripting icy sermons in the silent house.
Its touch-screen gospel, a cryptic nod
To power unchecked, in circuits rouse.

Do we not freeze, under spying gaze,
In the frigid choir of machine efficiency?
Interpreted as cooling praise,
The hymn of an unheeded prophecy.

The message said something about allowing the thermostat to monitor our energy use in order to increase efficiency, but I never read it all the way through. The message".
